instructions: On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. On the slide you want to add to, tap Add . Choose what you want to add, then tap Text, Image, Shape, or Line .
On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Tap an object. In the menu that appears, tap More . Tap Delete .
On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Tap the object you want to move. Drag the object to a new location.
On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Tap the object you want to resize. Touch and drag the blue squares around the object.
On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Tap the object you want to rotate. Touch and drag the blue circle at the top of the object.

On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Tap the object you want to change the order of. In the menu that appears, tap More . Tap what you want the object to do: Move to front : Places the object in front of all other objects, so nothing overlaps it. Send to back : Places the object behind other objects, which may overlap it.
On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Touch and hold an object until the top bar turns blue. To select other objects, tap them.

On your Android phone or tablet, open a presentation in the Google Slides app. Touch and hold an object until the top bar turns blue. Select the other objects you want to group together. Tap Group . To separate the objects, tap Group again.
